column4: How do I access a share on my ubuntu PC? I set up the share like it says in the wiki, but I can't access the share from my windows PC.
How do I access a share on my ubuntu PC? I set up the share like it says in the wiki, but I can't access the share from my windows PC.
you need to make a windows user that has the same username and password as on your ubuntu box
do you know of a fix?
give me a sec

make sure your username and password are the same on both boxes. if theyre not, this will never work. once youre sure of that, try mounting the share using, the 'net share' command in windows.  it mounts the share manually, and ive had to use it before to do this. this site will help: http://www.microsoft.com/resources/documentation/windows/xp/all/proddocs/en-us/net_share.mspx?mfr=true
and here: http://www.microsoft.com/resources/documentation/windows/xp/all/proddocs/en-us/file_srv_create_share.mspx?mfr=true
erm... I'm using Vista :S
whatev, thatll still probly work

and you should probly ask in #windows too. but basically windows sucks so much that it cant even handle its own smb protocol properly. you wont have any of these problems when mounting samaba shares on a linux box
I found one thing: my user account was Bigtoe on this PC and bigtoe on ubuntu
yeah thatll cause problems
dude, if youre talking to me, you need to prefix your statement with my nick, so i can see it :)
I know. I'm used to small channels :P
im tellin ya, try out the net share command. its like the manual way of doing what you want. and sometimes itll work when the "normal" way doesnt
yay, it works!
cool, howd you do it?
good stuff
I just did sudo smbpasswd -a system_username and entered the password
of course, I replaced system_username with bigtoe :P
nice
now I need to install sshd so I can get my other monitor back on this PC :P
